instruction: List all quiz and exam dates for the Sep 2024 term.
response: Quiz 1: Sunday, October 27, 2024; Quiz 2: Sunday, December 1, 2024; End term exam: Sunday, December 22, 2024.

instruction: Explain the format of the OPPE exams.
context: The OPPE exams are scheduled for multiple days.
response: The OPPE exams are conducted online in a remote proctored format over several days, specifically OPPE1 on November 16-17, 2024, and OPPE2 on December 7-15, 2024.

instruction: Identify the subjects associated with each OPPE exam.
response: OPPE1 is associated with Dip-MLP & Deg-C prog and FL-Python; OPPE2 covers subjects like Dip - SC, Dip - DBMS, PDSA, Java, MLP, and Deg - Big Data.

instruction: List the assignment deadlines for Week 1.
response: For Week 1, the assignment deadlines are: Foundation - Wednesday, October 2, 2024; Diploma - Sunday, October 6, 2024.

instruction: What is the policy on changing assignment deadlines?
response: None of the assignment deadlines will be changed this time from the schedule given.

instruction: Provide the content release date for Week 3.
response: The content release date for Week 3 is Friday, October 4, 2024.

instruction: List the dates for Week 11.
response: Week 11 dates are Friday, November 29, 2024, and Wednesday, December 11, 2024.

instruction: Explain the eligibility criteria for final exams in Week 9.
response: Eligibility for final exams in Week 9 depends on the average assignment scores of the best 5 out of the first 9 weeks.

instruction: What changes were made to the schedule and why?
context: The text mentions changes related to quizzes and festivals.
response: The schedule was changed to accommodate a quiz on October 27 and Diwali on October 31, affecting weeks 6 and 7.

instruction: List all diploma level orientation sessions and their timings.
response:
The diploma level orientation sessions are as follows:
1. Java/PDSA/SC/App dev1/Appdev2/DBMS - Sunday, Sep 8 2024, 6pm
2. MLF/MLT/MLP - Sunday, Sep 8 2024, 8pm
3. BDM/BA/TDS - Sunday, Sep 8 2024, 9pm

instruction: What degree level orientations are scheduled for Monday, Sep 9 2024?
response:
On Monday, Sep 9 2024, the degree level orientations scheduled are:
1. Introduction to NLP, Corporate Finance - 5pm
2. (Sw Engg + Sw Testing + C Programming + Advanced Algorithms + PSOSM + CSD + Statistical Computing) - 6pm
3. (AI: SMPS + DL + Big Data + Speech Tech) - 8pm

instruction: Provide the dates and details for project orientation sessions.
response:
The project orientation sessions are scheduled as follows:
- Sep 23, 2024, 7pm: Appdev 1 Project
- Sep 24, 2024, 7pm: Appdev 2 Project
- Sep 25, 2024, 7pm: ML Project
- Sep 26, 2024, 7pm: BDM Project

instruction: What must a student complete before being scheduled for OPPE1?
response: A student must complete the OPPE System Compatibility Test (SCT) exam.

instruction: What happens if a student fails to meet the eligibility criteria for the final exam?
response: If a student fails to meet the eligibility criteria for the final exam, OPPE2 will not be scheduled, and they will receive a WA/WQ grade, requiring them to repeat the entire course.

instruction: Where can I find the Standard Operating Procedure (SoP) document for the OPPE SCT exam?
response: You can find the Standard Operating Procedure (SoP) document for the OPPE SCT exam by clicking [here](https://www.google.com/url?q=https://docs.google.com/document/d/13WhnPprgKrgMfJ-Ep9IJQdolharbkY4ucrrfQYVoe4c/pub&sa=D&source=editors&ust=1726257172103306&usg=AOvVaw2CW1ISmz7ix503Nm-f4Lp5).

instruction: List the initial courses available for data science.
response: The initial courses available for data science include Mathematics for Data Science 1, English 1, Computational Thinking, and Statistics for Data Science 1.

instruction: What are the suggested pathways for Diploma level courses?
response: The suggested pathways for Diploma level courses include Machine Learning Foundations, Machine Learning Techniques, Machine Learning Practice, Business Data Management, Business Analytics, and Tools in Data Science.

instruction: Identify the assignment deadlines mentioned for Business Analytics.
response: The assignment deadlines for Business Analytics (BA) are specifically listed as Business Analytics (BA) Assignment Deadlines.

instruction: List the courses related to application development.
response: The courses related to application development are: Application Development - 1, Application Development - 2.

instruction: What programming language is mentioned for learning programming concepts?
response: The programming language mentioned for learning programming concepts is Java.

instruction: Identify two degree level courses from the text.
response: Two degree level courses mentioned are Software Testing and Deep Learning.

instruction: What are the criteria for earning course participation marks?
response: The criteria for course participation marks include: they are applicable based on the availability of mock activities in the course, can vary from 0-2 marks, and students will receive 2 marks if the average marks obtained in all mock tests conducted before Quiz 1 & Quiz 2 is >= 40/100.

instruction: How will bonus marks affect a student's course grade?
response: Bonus marks for course participation will only impact the course grade for students who pass the course and will not affect the pass criteria.

instruction: Explain the relationship between mock tests and course participation marks.
response: The availability of mock tests influences the course participation marks. If the average score of the mock tests before Quiz 1 & Quiz 2 is 40/100 or higher, students will earn 2 marks.

instruction: What are the criteria for earning badges in the Discourse forum?
context: The course emphasizes participation in the Discourse forum to encourage student engagement.
response: Badges are awarded based on the number of hours spent reading posts in Discourse: Badge 1 for up to 4 hours, Badge 2 for up to 8 hours, and Badge 3 for 12 hours or more.

instruction: Explain the grading system used in the course.
context: Understanding the grading scale is crucial for students to know their academic standing.
response: The grading system consists of grades S, A, B, C, D, E for passing, and U for failing. Additionally, the I grade has specific conditions for absence.

instruction: How can students earn bonus marks in the course?
context: Bonus activities can enhance student engagement and academic performance.
response: Students can earn up to 3 bonus marks if the course team sets up additional activities. If no such activities are established, the bonus marks will not be applicable.

instruction: What happens if I fail the OPPE but pass the ET exam?
response: If you fail the OPPE but cross the cutoff for the ET exam as per the course grading policy, your grade will be recorded as I/OP.

instruction: Can I register for the OPPE after failing it?
context: You have previously failed the OPPE.
response: Yes, you can register to do the OPPE alone. If the course has one OPPE, it will be scheduled for you; if there are two, both will be scheduled.

instruction: What grade will I receive if I failed the OPPE and was absent for the ET exam?
response: If you fail the OPPE and are absent for the ET exam, your grade will be recorded as I/BOTH.

instruction: What are the scheduled dates for OPPE 1?
context: The OPPE schedule for the September 2024 term includes multiple assessment days.
response: OPPE 1 is scheduled for Saturday, November 16, 2024, and Sunday, November 17, 2024.

instruction: Explain the option to repeat the course.
context: There is a mention of reattempting assessment components.
response: You can choose to repeat the entire course instead of just doing the ET/OPPE if you want to reattempt all assessment components.

instruction: List the subjects assessed on OPPE 1 Day 1.
context: The OPPE schedule includes various subjects for different days.
response: On OPPE 1 Day 1, the subjects assessed are Python, DBMS, PDSA, Java, SC, MLP, C, and Intro to Big Data.

instruction: What are the dates and times for OPPE 2 sessions?
response: The OPPE 2 sessions are scheduled as follows: Day 3 on Saturday, December 14, 2024, from 07:00 PM to 09:00 PM, and Day 4 on Sunday, December 15, 2024, from 09:30 AM to 11:00 AM.

instruction: Explain the new rules for Foundation Level courses starting in May 2024.
response: For those entering Foundation Level in May 2024 or after, the new rules require students to complete 4, 6, or 8 courses in 4, 6, or 9 terms, respectively. Failure to do so may result in removal from the program.

instruction: Where can I find the suggested pathway to register for Foundation level courses?
response: The suggested pathway to register and study Foundation level courses can be found in the provided image link.

instruction: What are the dates for the quizzes and the end term for the Mathematics course?
response: Quiz 1 is on October 27, 2024, Quiz 2 is on December 1, 2024, and the end term is on December 22, 2024.

instruction: Explain the eligibility criteria to write the final exam in the Mathematics course.
response: To be eligible to write the final exam, a student must have an average of the best 5 out of the first 9 weeks of weekly assignment scores that is greater than or equal to 40/100 and must attend one of the two quizzes.

instruction: How is the final course score calculated for eligible students in the Mathematics course?
response: The final course score T is calculated using the formula: T = 0.1GAA + max(0.6F + 0.2max(Qz1, Qz2), 0.4F + 0.2Qz1 + 0.3Qz2), where GAA is the average score in the best 10 out of the first 11 weekly graded assignments, F is the final exam score, and Qz1 and Qz2 are the scores in Quiz 1 and Quiz 2 respectively.

instruction: Explain the eligibility criteria for writing the final exam.
response: To be eligible to write the final exam, students must have an average of the best 5 out of the first 9 weeks of weekly assignment scores that is greater than or equal to 40 out of 100, and they must attend one of the two quizzes.

instruction: How is the final course score T calculated?
response: The final course score T for eligible students is calculated using the formula: T = 0.1GAA + max(0.6F + 0.2max(Qz1, Qz2), 0.4F + 0.2Qz1 + 0.3Qz2), where GAA is the average score in the best 10 out of the first 11 weekly graded assignments, F is the final exam score, and Qz1 and Qz2 are the scores from Quiz I and Quiz II, respectively.

instruction: When are the quizzes and the end term exam scheduled?
response: Quiz 1 is scheduled for October 27th, 2024, Quiz 2 for December 1st, 2024, and the end term exam is set for December 22nd, 2024.

instruction: What are the eligibility requirements to obtain the final course grade?
response: To obtain the final course grade, students must have an average score of at least 40/100 in the best 5 out of the first 9 weekly assignments and must attend one of the two quizzes.

instruction: How is the final course score calculated for eligible students?
response: The final course score T for eligible students is calculated using the formula: T = 0.1GAA + max(0.6F + 0.2max(Qz1, Qz2), 0.4F + 0.2Qz1 + 0.3Qz2), where GAA is the average score from the best 10 out of the first 11 weekly assignments, F is the final exam score, and Qz1 and Qz2 are the scores from Quiz I and Quiz II respectively.

instruction: When are the quizzes and final exam scheduled?
response: Quiz 1 is scheduled for October 27th, 2024, Quiz 2 for December 1st, 2024, and the final exam will take place on December 22nd, 2024.
